Formerly Asian Oil and Paint Company Pvt. Ltd. (19451965) [ 1 ] Asian Paints (India) Pvt. Ltd. (19651973) [ 1 ] Company type Public Traded as BSE : 50082 NSE : ASIANPAINT BSE SENSEX constituent NSE NIFTY 50 constituent ISIN INE021A01026 Industry Chemicals Founded 1February 1942 ; 83 years ago ( 1942-02-01 ) Founders Champaklal Choksey Chimanlal Choksi Suryakant Dani Arvind Vakil [ 2 ] Headquarters Mumbai , Maharashtra , India Area served Worldwide Key people Manish Choksi ( Vice Chairman ) Amit Syngle ( CEO ) Products Chemicals Decorative paints Industrial finishing products Coatings Revenue 36,183 crore (US$4.3billion) (2024) Operating income 7,215 crore (US$850million) (2024) Net income 5,558 crore (US$660million) (2024) Total assets 29,924 crore (US$3.5billion) (2024) Total equity 19,424 crore (US$2.3billion) (2024) Number of employees 9,482 permanent & 21,189 contractual (2024) [ 3 ] Website asianpaints.com Footnotes/ references Financials as of 31March2024 [update] . [ 4 ] Asian Paints Ltd is an Indian multinational paint company, headquartered in Mumbai . [ 2 ] The company is engaged in the business of manufacturing, selling and distribution of paints, coatings, products related to home dcor, bath fittings and providing related services. Asian Paints is India's largest paints company by market share. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] The company has 27 paint manufacturing facilities in 15 countries, servicing consumers in over 60 countries. Asian Paints is also present in the home improvement and dcor space in India. [ 7 ] History [ edit ] The company was started in a garage in Gaiwadi, Girgaon , Mumbai by four friends Champaklal Choksey, Chimanlal Choksi, Suryakant Dani and Arvind Vakil, in February 1942. [ 2 ] During World War II and the Quit India Movement of 1942, a temporary ban on paint imports left only foreign companies and Shalimar Paints in the market. Asian Paints took up the market and reported an annual turnover of 23 crore in 1952 but with only 2% PBT margin. By 1967, it became the leading paints manufacturer in the country. [ 8 ] [ 9 ] Asian Paints established its first overseas subsidiary in 1978 in Fiji , [ 10 ] before expanding into Nepal in 1983. [ 11 ] The company made its first international acquisition in 1999, when it took over Sri Lanka 's second largest paint company, Delmege Forsyth & Co. [ 12 ] In 2000, it began operations in Oman through a joint venture with the Al Hassan Group. [ 13 ] In 2002, Asian Paints acquired a 60% stake in Egyptian paint manufacturer SCIB Chemicals for 24.5 crore (US$5.04 million). [ 14 ] It also acquired a 50.1% stake in the SGX -listed Berger International Singapore, which had operations in 11 countries across Southeast Asia , West Asia , the Caribbean , China and Malta , for US$20.8 million. Over the course of 25 years, Asian Paints became a corporate force and India\'s leading paints company. Driven by its strong consumer-focus and innovative spirit, the company has been the market leader in paints since 1967. Innovation and Market Leadership Asian Paints quickly distinguished itself from competitors by focusing on innovation and customer satisfaction. In the 1950s and 60s, the company revolutionized the industry by introducing smaller pack sizes, making paint more accessible to a broader audience. In the 1970s, Asian Paints continued its innovative streak by developing computer color matching technology, which allowed for a broader range of colors and more accurate mixing. This technological advancement set them apart from competitors and cemented their position as an industry leader. asian_paints_info.text: [{'url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asian_Paints', 'content': "Asian Paints - Wikipedia Jump to content Main menu Main menu move to sidebar hide Navigation Main page Contents Current events Random article About Wikipedia Contact us Contribute Help Learn to edit Community portal Recent changes Upload file Special pages Search Search Appearance Donate Create account Log in Personal tools Donate Create account Log in Pages for logged out editors learn more Contributions Talk Contents move to sidebar hide (Top) 1 History 2 Corporate structure Toggle Corporate structure subsection 2.1 Ownership 2.2 Shareholding pattern 3 Manufacturing locations 4 Marketing and advertising 5 References 6 External links Toggle the table of contents Asian Paints 9 languages  Deutsch    Edit links Article Talk English Read Edit View history Tools Tools move to sidebar hide Actions Read Edit View history General What links here Related changes Upload file Permanent link Page information Cite this page Get shortened URL Download QR code Print/export Download as PDF Printable version In other projects Wikidata item Appearance move to sidebar hide From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia Indian multinational paint company Asian Paints Ltd. Formerly Asian Oil and Paint Company Pvt. Ltd. (19451965) [ 1 ] Asian Paints (India) Pvt. Ltd. (19651973) [ 1 ] Company type Public Traded as BSE : 50082 NSE : ASIANPAINT BSE SENSEX constituent NSE NIFTY 50 constituent ISIN INE021A01026 Industry Chemicals Founded 1February 1942 ; 83 years ago ( 1942-02-01 ) Founders Champaklal Choksey Chimanlal Choksi Suryakant Dani Arvind Vakil [ 2 ] Headquarters Mumbai , Maharashtra , India Area served Worldwide Key people Manish Choksi ( Vice Chairman ) Amit Syngle ( CEO ) Products Chemicals Decorative paints Industrial finishing products Coatings Revenue 36,183 crore (US$4.3billion) (2024) Operating income 7,215 crore (US$850million) (2024) Net income 5,558 crore (US$660million) (2024) Total assets 29,924 crore (US$3.5billion) (2024) Total equity 19,424 crore (US$2.3billion) (2024) Number of employees 9,482 permanent & 21,189 contractual (2024) [ 3 ] Website asianpaints.com Footnotes/ references Financials as of 31March2024 [update] . [ 4 ] Asian Paints Ltd is an Indian multinational paint company, headquartered in Mumbai . [ 2 ] The company is engaged in the business of manufacturing, selling and distribution of paints, coatings, products related to home dcor, bath fittings and providing related services. Asian Paints is India's largest paints company by market share. [ 5 ] [ 6 ] The company has 27 paint manufacturing facilities in 15 countries, servicing consumers in over 60 countries. Asian Paints is also present in the home improvement and dcor space in India. [ 7 ] History [ edit ] The company was started in a garage in Gaiwadi, Girgaon , Mumbai by four friends Champaklal Choksey, Chimanlal Choksi, Suryakant Dani and Arvind Vakil, in February 1942. [ 2 ] During World War II and the Quit India Movement of 1942, a temporary ban on paint imports left only foreign companies and Shalimar Paints in the market. Asian Paints took up the market and reported an annual turnover of 23 crore in 1952 but with only 2% PBT margin. By 1967, it became the leading paints manufacturer in the country. [ 8 ] [ 9 ] Asian Paints established its first overseas subsidiary in 1978 in Fiji , [ 10 ] before expanding into Nepal in 1983. [ 11 ] The company made its first international acquisition in 1999, when it took over Sri Lanka 's second largest paint company, Delmege Forsyth & Co. [ 12 ] In 2000, it began operations in Oman through a joint venture with the Al Hassan Group. [ 13 ] In 2002, Asian Paints acquired a 60% stake in Egyptian paint manufacturer SCIB Chemicals for 24.5 crore (US$5.04 million). [ 14 ] It also acquired a 50.1% stake in the SGX -listed Berger International Singapore, which had operations in 11 countries across Southeast Asia , West Asia , the Caribbean , China and Malta , for US$20.8 million. It was set up as a partnership firm by four friends who were willing to take on the world\'s biggest, most famous paint companies operating in India at that time. Over the course of 25 years, Asian Paints became a corporate force and India\'s leading paints company. Driven by its strong consumer-focus and innovative spirit, the company has been the market leader in paints since 1967. Asian Paints manufactures a wide range of paints for decorative and industrial use and also offers water proofing, adhesives and services under its portfolio. The company is also present in the Home Decor segment and offers Modular kitchens and wardrobes, Bath fittings and sanitaryware, Decorative lightings, uPVC windows and doors, wall coverings, Furniture, Fabric & Furnishings and Rugs. Here's their story: Founding: Asian Paints was founded in 1942 by four friends - Champaklal Choksey, Chimanlal Choksey, Suryakant Dani, and Arvind Vakil - in a small garage in Mumbai. Initial Struggles: The company faced stiff competition from established players and struggled to find its footing in the market. Turning Point: Asian Paints' fortunes changed when they introduced innovative products, expanded their distribution network, and invested in marketing and branding. Key Factors Contributing to Success: 1. Innovative Products: Introduced a range of innovative products, including exterior and interior paints, enamels, and varnishes. 2.Strong Distribution Network: Established a robust distribution network, making products widely available. 3.Effective Marketing Strategies: Leveraged iconic advertising campaigns, sponsorships, and events to create brand awareness. 4. Quality and Customer Focus: Emphasized on maintaining high-quality products and delivering exceptional customer service. Achievements: 1. Market Leadership: Became India's largest paint company, with a market share of over 50%. 2. Global Expansion: Expanded operations to over 15 countries, including the Middle East, South Asia, and Southeast Asia. 3. Awards and Recognition: Received numerous awards for innovation, marketing, and corporate governance. Lessons Learned: 1. Innovate and Adapt: Stay ahead of the competition by continuously innovating and adapting to changing market trends. 2. Focus on Quality and Customer Service: Prioritize quality and customer satisfaction to build trust and loyalty. 3. Strong Distribution Network: Establish a robust distribution network to make products widely available. Asian Paints' success story serves as an inspiration for entrepreneurs and businesses, highlighting the importance of innovation, quality, and effective marketing strategies. Asian Paints Turnover . Annual Turnover: Asian Paints' annual turnover for 2023 was $4.28 billion, up from $4.18 billion in 2022 . Quarterly Turnover: The company's turnover for Q1 2024-2025 was 9,162.66Cr, a 2.63% decrease from the same period last year . nodes.description: Research Asian Paints' market position, including market share, competitive landscape, and key competitors.
nodes.agent_prompt: Investigate Asian Paints' market position, including its market share in the paints and coatings industry, the competitive landscape, and its key competitors. Gather data on market trends, growth rates, and the company's competitive advantages and disadvantages. Use market research reports, industry publications, and competitor analysis from reliable sources.

nodes.description: Gather data on Asian Paints' key competitors, including their market share, financial performance, product offerings, and competitive strategies.
nodes.agent_prompt: Collect information on Asian Paints' key competitors, focusing on their market share, financial performance, product offerings, and competitive strategies. This should include a detailed analysis of their strengths and weaknesses, and how they compare to Asian Paints. Use competitor analysis reports, financial news, and industry publications.

nodes.description: Analyze the data collected on Asian Paints' business overview and financial performance to create visualizations (graphs and tables) showcasing revenue trends, profit margins, and other key financial metrics.
nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the data gathered on Asian Paints' business overview from T001 and financial performance from T002 to create visualizations (graphs and tables) illustrating revenue trends, profit margins, key financial ratios, and balance sheet information. Ensure that the visualizations are clear, concise, and effectively communicate the financial performance of the company. The visualizations should be designed to be included in an HTML report and can use libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, or plotly. Save the graphs in appropriate image format for websites like .png and .jpeg. Make sure each file has a unique name to avoid overwriting. Return links of created images in the output.

nodes.description: Compare Asian Paints' market position and competitive strategies with its key competitors, and create visualizations (graphs and tables) that highlight the comparisons.
nodes.agent_prompt: Compare Asian Paints' market position and competitive strategies (collected in T003) with its key competitors (collected in T004). Create visualizations (graphs and tables) that highlight the comparisons in market share, financial performance, product offerings, and competitive strategies. Ensure that the visualizations clearly show the relative strengths and weaknesses of Asian Paints compared to its competitors. The visualizations should be suitable for inclusion in an HTML report. Save the graphs in appropriate image format for websites like .png and .jpeg. Make sure each file has a unique name to avoid overwriting. Return links of created images in the output.

nodes.description: Create a comprehensive and well-formatted HTML report on Asian Paints, including the business overview, financial performance analysis, market position analysis, competitor comparison, and visualizations generated in the previous steps.
nodes.agent_prompt:
Create a comprehensive and well-formatted HTML report on Asian Paints. The report should include:

- A detailed business overview (from T001).
- A thorough analysis of financial performance, including revenue trends, profit margins, key financial ratios, and balance sheet information (from T002), along with visualizations generated in T005.
- An analysis of Asian Paints' market position, including market share, competitive landscape, and key competitors (from T003 and T004), along with visualizations generated in T006.
- A comparison of Asian Paints with its key competitors, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses.

Ensure the report is well-structured, visually appealing, and easy to read. Use appropriate HTML tags, CSS styling, and incorporate the visualizations (graphs and tables) effectively to enhance the report's clarity and impact. The visualizations are available in the output fields of T005 and T006, ready to be embedded. DO NOT CALL CoderAgent, as CoderAgent cannot create visually appealing HTML reports. Use HTML formatting. The final output has to be just the final HTML report.
